title: 110_s2314
content: The Geothermal Heat Pump Development Act of 2007 establishes energy credits for geothermal heat pump systems, allowing for equipment that uses the ground or ground water as a thermal energy source to qualify. The Act also provides a residential energy efficient property credit for geothermal heat pump systems. The Geothermal Heat Pump Development Act of 2007 introduces energy credits for geothermal heat pump systems, including a 30 percent credit for qualified geothermal heat pump property expenditures made by taxpayers. This includes expenditures for qualified geothermal heat pump property installed in connection with a dwelling unit. The Geothermal Heat Pump Development Act of 2007 offers a 30 percent credit for qualified geothermal heat pump property expenditures made by taxpayers for equipment that uses the ground or ground water as a thermal energy source to heat or cool a dwelling unit in the United States. The Geothermal Heat Pump Development Act of 2007 provides a 30 percent credit for qualified geothermal heat pump property expenditures. The maximum credit limitation is $2,000 for such expenditures, and the credit is reduced by any credit allowed under section 25C for the same expenditures. The Geothermal Heat Pump Development Act of 2007 offers a 30% credit for qualified geothermal heat pump property expenditures, with a maximum limit of $2,000. The credit can be reduced by any credit allowed under section 25C. Amendments allow the credit to be applied against alternative minimum tax liabilities. The Geothermal Heat Pump Development Act of 2007 provides a 30% credit for qualified geothermal heat pump property expenditures, capped at $2,000. The credit can offset alternative minimum tax liabilities. Amendments allow excess credits to be carried forward to the following taxable year. The amendments made by this section expand the allowable credit for geothermal heat pump property expenditures and allow excess credits to be carried forward to the following taxable year. These changes apply to expenditures made after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 4. 3-YEAR ACCELERATED DEPRECIATION PERIOD FOR GEOTHERMAL HEAT PUMP SYSTEMS. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to include geothermal heat pump systems for accelerated depreciation. Effective for property placed in service after the enactment of the Act.
